title: error: internal compiler error

labels.name: I-ICE
labels.description: Issue: The compiler panicked, giving an Internal Compilation Error (ICE) ❄️

body:
The compiler crashes with an `internal compiler error` when attempting to `cargo test`.

I tried this code:

```rs
#![feature(trait_alias)]

// Standard
use core::hash::Hash;

trait Key = Hash;
```

I expected to see this happen: It not crashing

Instead, this happened: It crashed

## Meta

```
rustc 1.32.0-nightly (6f93e93af 2018-11-14)
binary: rustc
commit-hash: 6f93e93af6f823948cc13d2938957757c6486d88
commit-date: 2018-11-14
host: x86_64-unknown-linux-gnu
release: 1.32.0-nightly
LLVM version: 8.0
```

Backtrace:

```
error: internal compiler error: librustc_metadata/encoder.rs:1158: cannot encode info for item Item { name: Key, id: NodeId(17), hir_id: HirId { owner: DefIndex(0:4), local_id: ItemLocalId(0) }, attrs: [], node: TraitAlias(Generics { params: [], where_clause: WhereClause { id: NodeId(18), predicates: [] }, span: src/lib.rs:1:1: 1:1 }, [Trait(PolyTraitRef { bound_generic_params: [], trait_ref: TraitRef { path: path(Hash), ref_id: NodeId(19), hir_ref_id: HirId { owner: DefIndex(0:4), local_id: ItemLocalId(3) } }, span: src/lib.rs:6:13: 6:17 }, None)]), vis: Spanned { node: Inherited, span: src/lib.rs:6:1: 6:1 }, span: src/lib.rs:6:1: 6:18 }

thread 'main' panicked at 'Box<Any>', librustc_errors/lib.rs:600:9

             at libstd/sys/unix/backtrace/tracing/gcc_s.rs:49

             at libstd/panicking.rs:480

   9: rustc::ty::context::tls::with_opt::{{closure}}

note: the compiler unexpectedly panicked. this is a bug.

note: we would appreciate a bug report: https://github.com/rust-lang/rust/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md#bug-reports

note: rustc 1.32.0-nightly (6f93e93af 2018-11-14) running on x86_64-unknown-linux-gnu

note: compiler flags: -C debuginfo=2 -C incremental --crate-type lib

note: some of the compiler flags provided by cargo are hidden

error: Could not compile `smash`.
warning: build failed, waiting for other jobs to finish...
error: build failed
```

I won't pretend to be familiar enough with the compiler to investigate this myself yet.
